page.title: 15SHINFIELD-PAST & PRESENT (1)
page.content:
SHINFIELD VILLAGE GOES BACK TO LATE SAXON TIMES.THE DOMESDAY BOOK ENTRY IN 1086 STATES THAT BEFORE THE NORMAN CONQUEST IT WAS OWNED BY SEXI HUSCARLE,BUT THAT IT WAS THEN OWNED BY WILLIAM FITZ OSBERN.ST.MARY'S CHURCH WAS BUILT BETWEEN 1069 AND 1074. IN 1707 THE VILLAGE SCHOOL WAS BUILT. THIS IS NOW THE COUNTY INFANTS SCHOOL AND STANDS ON THE SCHOOL GREEN OPPOSITE THE TWO PUBLIC HOUSES,THE 'ROYAL OAK' AND THE 'BELL AND BOTTLE'. THE CHURCH HAS HAD A LOT OF BUILDING ADDED:THE TOWER ON THE FRONT,THE SOUTH AISLE AND THE MARTYN CHAPEL AT THE BACK.
IN 1807 THE POPULATION WAS APPROX. 870 AND BY 1901 HAD RISEN TO ABOUT 1600.IN 1985 THE POPULATION IS OVER 7000 AND STILL RISING.
